org.apache.hive.common.util

Class HiveStringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hive.common.util.HiveStringUtils

  • @InterfaceAudience.Private
 @InterfaceStability.Unstable
public class HiveStringUtils
extends Object
    HiveStringUtils General string utils Originally copied from o.a.hadoop.util.StringUtils

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HiveStringUtils.TraditionalBinaryPrefix
      The traditional binary prefixes, kilo, mega, ..., exa, which can be represented by a 64-bit integer.

      • humanReadableInt

        public static String humanReadableInt(long number)
        Given an integer, return a string that is in an approximate, but human readable format. It uses the bases 'k', 'm', and 'g' for 1024, 1024**2, and 1024**3.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to format
        Returns:
        a human readable form of the integer

        digits - the number of digits past the decimal point

      • hexStringToByte

        public static byte[] hexStringToByte(String hex)
        Given a hexstring this will return the byte array corresponding to the string
        Parameters:
        hex - the hex String array
        Returns:
        a byte array that is a hex string representation of the given string. The size of the byte array is therefore hex.length/2

        public static URI[] stringToURI(String[] str)
        Parameters:
        str - The string array to be parsed into an URI array.
        Returns:
        null if str is null, else the URI array equivalent to str.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any string in str violates RFC 2396.

      • formatTimeDiff

        public static String formatTimeDiff(long finishTime,
                                    long startTime)
        Given a finish and start time in long milliseconds, returns a String in the format Xhrs, Ymins, Z sec, for the time difference between two times. If finish time comes before start time then negative valeus of X, Y and Z wil return.
        Parameters:
        finishTime - finish time
        startTime - start time

      • formatTime

        public static String formatTime(long timeDiff)
        Given the time in long milliseconds, returns a String in the format Xhrs, Ymins, Z sec.
        Parameters:
        timeDiff - The time difference to format

      • getFormattedTimeWithDiff

        public static String getFormattedTimeWithDiff(DateFormat dateFormat,
                                              long finishTime,
                                              long startTime)
        Formats time in ms and appends difference (finishTime - startTime) as returned by formatTimeDiff(). If finish time is 0, empty string is returned, if start time is 0 then difference is not appended to return value.
        Parameters:
        dateFormat - date format to use
        finishTime - fnish time
        startTime - start time
        Returns:
        formatted value.

                                        char escapeChar,
                                        char separator)
        Split a string using the specified separator/escape character, then unescape the resulting array of strings using the same escape/separator.

        escapeChar - a char that be used to escape the separator
        separator - a separator char
        Returns:
        an array of unescaped strings

      • insertValue

        public static String insertValue(String key,
                                 String newValue,
                                 String strKvPairs)
        In a given string of comma-separated key=value pairs insert a new value of a given key
        Parameters:
        key - The key whose value needs to be replaced
        newValue - The new value of the key
        strKvPairs - Comma separated key=value pairs Eg: "k1=v1, k2=v2, k3=v3"
        Returns:
        Comma separated string of key=value pairs with the new value for key keyName

      • findNext

        public static int findNext(String str,
                           char separator,
                           char escapeChar,
                           int start,
                           StringBuilder split)
        Finds the first occurrence of the separator character ignoring the escaped separators starting from the index. Note the substring between the index and the position of the separator is passed.
        Parameters:
        str - the source string
        separator - the character to find
        escapeChar - character used to escape
        start - from where to search
        split - used to pass back the extracted string

      • removeComments

        public static String removeComments(String statement)
        Strip comments from a sql statement, tracking when the statement contains a string literal.
        Parameters:
        statement - the input string
        Returns:
        a stripped statement

      • removeComments

        public static String removeComments(String line,
                                    int[] startQuote)
        Remove comments from the current line of a query. Avoid removing comment-like strings inside quotes.
        Parameters:
        line - a line of sql text
        startQuote - The value -1 indicates that line does not begin inside a string literal. Other values indicate that line does begin inside a string literal and the value passed is the delimiter character. The array type is used to pass int type as input/output parameter.
        Returns:
        the line with comments removed.
